content: this legal text summarizes a court case in venice involving three sisters who were disputing the division of their mothers assets after her death the court initially ruled for equal division but one sister appealed the appeals court accepted the appeal and crossappeals and made several rulings they determined the value of movable assets and assigned specific properties to each sister they also clarified the applicable laws and summarized the arguments made by each party the court addressed the grounds of appeal and crossappeal and made decisions regarding the identification and allocation of movable assets the court partially accepted the main appeal and crossappeals reforming the original judgment they determined the movable assets to include securities files and a bank account balance one sister was assigned certain offices and miniapartments in venice and mirano along with half of the movable assets the other sisters were assigned apartments in venice and a miniapartment in mirano along with the remaining half of the movable assets the court confirmed the rest of the original judgment and declared that the parties had fully compensated for the costs the ruling was made on may 27 2003

metadata.CASE_ID: Corte appello Venezia sez. II, 27/05/2003, n.1828
